ovdesc.p: This file is used to record the details of collateral submitted by a customer, its value(s) and, optionally, to link it directly to a customer's supporting deal elsewhere in the system.
Each collateral object belongs to a collateral right. This is implicit in the item-id structures of the file.
NOMINAL, EXECUTION, THIRD PARTY, GENERAL LEDGER & CENTRAL BANK VALUES
There are five value fields associated with each collateral record.

The allowable forms of input to these fields are determined by the fields of the same name on the collateral type file. They make take different meanings in the context of different types of collateral.
User-input to them may be defined as mandatory, optional or not allowed.
If input is fed from another application these values are placed automatically by the system when the application id is given.
The third possible form of update to these fields is by calculation, in which case the appropriate values are placed by the system when the fields required for the calculation have been entered.

There are descriptive and notes fields on the collateral record. Since the other items of (descriptive) information regarding the collateral object itself are (a) not used in processing and (b) quite different depending on the type of collateral, these further details should be defined by the use of local reference tables (in conjunction with program versions).

desc.p: A value which represents a prior or third party right to the collateral.
One of five value fields attached to the collateral.
This value is a value attached to the collateral which is not available under the right itself. It usually represents a third party value in cases such as, for example, a second mortgage.
The value in this field is subtracted from the EXECUTION.VALUE in order to determine the net execution value.
The allowable form of input to this field is determined by the field of the same name on the collateral type file.
The third party value may be defined on this table as mandatory, optional or non-input.
Allows positive, negative or both balances depending on ALLOWED.ACT.BAL set in COLLATERAL.TYPE

No input is allowed if the collateral type record contains the definition 'N' in THIRD.PARTY.VALUE.
Input is mandatory if the collateral type record contains the definition 'M' in THIRD.PARTY.VALUE.
An override is required if the value exceeds the EXECUTION.VALUE.
The status of the collateral object.
The status of the collateral object is indicated in this field as follows:
FWD - forward status; validity date of the corresponding right is forward;
CUR - current status; expiry date of the corresponding right is forward & validity date is not;
LIQ - liquidated status; expiry date of either the corresponding right or the object itself is past;
MAT - matured status; record occurs only on history file.
EXC - Excluded status; collateral is marked for exclusion i.e. the EXCLUSION.ID field is not null

In most cases, the status indicated against the collateral object will be the same as that belonging to the corresponding right. Exceptions are when a collateral object has an earlier expiry date than its corresponding right (in which case the object is considered expired whilst the right remains current) and when a collateral is marked for exclusion
This field is automatically maintained by the system by an end-of-day process and is updated in accordance with any changes to the dates and exclusion id defined on-line.
'FWD', 'CUR', 'LIQ', 'MAT' or 'EXC'. Internal field. This is a NOINPUT field.

An upper limit to the value which can be entered by the user or generated by the system in EXECUTION.VALUE.
This field should be used if the EXECUTION.VALUE of the item is of a variable nature but is only pledged up to a certain amount. It represents the maximum pledged value of the item.

The system can be instructed to feed the EXECUTION.VALUE from a contract, account or portfolio elsewhere within T24. If a MAXIMUM.VALUE has been entered in this field, the EXECUTION.VALUE which is taken from the T24 application record will never exceed this amount, regardless of the actual value attached to it at the time.
The same principle applies both to user-input of an EXECUTION.VALUE and to a periodic revaluation of the EXECUTION.VALUE (i.e. that the MAXIMUM.VALUE, if entered, cannot be exceeded).

Unique identification of collateral object. This item-id consists of the collateral right id followed by a sequence number. The two are separated by a period (full stop).
The item-id by which the collateral object is identified.
The item-id to the collateral file is made up of three components, separated by a period (full stop).
The first two components correspond to the collateral right to which the collateral object belongs, and consist of a customer id followed by a sequence number.
The third component identifies, where required, further items of collateral belonging to the right of security. The default value of this sequence number is one.

When the customer number has been entered by the user, the system will automatically append the default sequence numbers of '.1.1'. The user may subsequently enter only the third (suffix) part of the item-id to bring up further records belonging to that right (or only the last two parts to bring up further records belonging to that customer).
1-10 digit numeric (customer id), period, 1-4 digit numeric (sequence number, collateral right), period, 1-4 digit numeric (sequence number, object).
The sequence number following the full stop may not be zero.

The contract or account id by which the collateral object is represented.
This field is used to link the collateral to a deposit or credit balance recorded elsewhere in the system.
Valid input is any contract/account number as follows:
account number; item-id to account file
bill contract number with OPERATION as COLLATERAL
fiduciary deposit (order) number
letter of credit transaction number
(loans &) deposits contract number,
miscellaneous deal number,
money market contract number,
securities portfolio number,
sub-asset group within a portfolio,
security id within a sub-asset group within a portfolio.

If a deposit contract, contingent asset or account is referenced, the system will calculate its current value and place this in NOMINAL.VALUE and/or EXECUTION.VALUE of the COLLATERAL record according to the definition of fed & fed/margin values.

If a portfolio number is entered, a similar action is taken, except that the system will first observe the definition of asset & sub-asset types belonging to the COLLATERAL.TYPE. The rules for defining assets of a portfolio and for the system's calculation of their value is described below.

If the APPLICATION.ID in this field is entered in the format: customer number; '-'; portfolio number; '.'; sub-asset type; '.'; asset type;'*'; security number. The actual collateral value will be the margin value of the individual security. Validation ensures the security number is valid and that it is part of the portfolio. The security number can be entered as either a full security number, a mnemonic or as short form input.

If the APPLICATION.ID in this field is entered in the format: customer number; '-'; portfolio number; '.'; sub-asset type; '.'; asset type, then it forms the key to a record on the SC POS ASSET file. This refers to a particular group of assets within a portfolio (as defined by asset & sub-asset type). In this case, the value of the collateral is calculated by taking the current value of the assets which belong to this group but not including any particular items which are defined elsewhere as collateral (i.e. individual accounts, deposits etc).

If the APPLICATION ID is entered in the format: customer number; '- '; portfolio number, then it refers to a record on the SEC.ACC.MASTER file and defines either the whole portfolio or a part of it according to the COLLATERAL.TYPE. The calculation of the associated value is described below.

If a SEC.ACC.MASTER id is entered, the system will check the COLLATERAL.TYPE record indicated by the content of field 1. If this record has a list or a range of asset & sub-asset types associated with it, the system will assign the value of only those assets of the portfolio which correspond to one of the defined types or fall within one of the defined ranges. The value of any individual accounts or contracts which are defined separately as collateral items will not be taken into account. If an individual SC POS ASSET record belonging to the portfolio is separately defined as a collateral item, its value, too, will be disregarded.

Finally, if a complete portfolio is referenced, by SEC.ACC.MASTER id under a COLLATERAL.TYPE for which no asset groupings have been defined, the full value of the portfolio is calculated. However, the same rules apply to individually defined items at a lower level of detail. In other words, values of individual assets will be ignored if they are separately defined (either by direct reference, by SC.POS.ASSET id or by inclusion in an asset group defined at the level of COLLATERAL.TYPE).
In each case, the reference given should belong to the customer mentioned in the item-id to the collateral record. If this is not the case, an override condition must be accepted.
